hours_text:
### Our Hours

Open Hours:

  * Wednesday - Saturday, 12pm - 5pm

Closures: 

  * Gallery Hours subject to change if closed for installation. View our Gallery Calendar [here](/gallery-calendar).

### Our Location

Address: 526 Broadway, Santa Cruz, Ca, 95060

Our convenient location is just minutes from downtown. Come visit us and explore our gift shop, gallery, and classrooms, as well as our blackbox theater!

admission_text:
# Membership

* * *

Interested in becoming a member of the Santa Cruz Art League? 

**Scroll down to view our membership types and join today!**

Our members enjoy: 

  * Discounts on classes & events.

  * Discounted or free submission into many of our exhibitions.

  * Exclusive opportunity to participate in our annual Member’s Show.

  * Higher commission rates for artwork sold in exhibitions.

  * Exclusive opportunity to sell your work in our lobby gift shop.

  * Ample opportunities to network with other artists, discover other exhibition venues and market places, and share techniques and supply sources.

  * Exclusive opportunity to be listed in our [SCAL Member Directory.](/member-directory)

  * Our Reciprocal Members also receive access to over 1300 galleries and museums all across the country! Read more about NARM membership [here!](https://narmassociation.org/)

**Please note that SCAL memberships are non-refundable.**

* * *
collections_text:
## The Santa Cruz Art League 

#### One of California’s most significant and historic arts organizations, the Santa Cruz Art League inspires creativity and community through vibrant visual and performing arts.

[ Our Vision ](/our-story-vision)

[ Become a Member ](/membership)

#### Come Visit Us!

Open Hours:

  * Wednesday - Saturday, 12pm - 5pm  

Closures: 

  * Gallery Hours subject to change if closed for installation. View our Gallery Calendar [here](/gallery-calendar).

# See What’s Happening!

### Exhibitions

* * *

_Our exhibitions are always free and open to the public to view!_

**Yermo Aranda Retrospective  
** _January 14, 2026 - February 20, 2026_

This exhibition showcases the vibrant and dramatic work of local multi-media artist Yerma Aranda. Known for his murals, Aranda was named Santa Cruz County Artist of the Year in 2021. His work is inspired by indigenous and aztec cultures.

**Back and Forth: The Unintended Beauty of Textiles  
** _March 4, 2026 – April 10, 2026_

Fiber artists often remark about how they like the backside of fiber arts pieces are often quite beautiful in an unexpected, unintentional, and raw way. In this exhibit textile artists will be invited to show two pieces - one piece shown with the intended side visible, and the other piece shown exposing the backside. 

[ Current Exhibition ](/current-exhibition)

[ Upcoming Exhibitions ](/upcoming-exhibitions)
